title: POND PLUNGE
body_text:
Ray Marzarella vs. Mike Edwards Results from 122!
January 19, 2008 - one man's date with destiny.
For blocking extraordinaire, a win over "The Crazy One" would have undeniably granted him the top ranking in the controversial, rebellious clan
PondScum
. After all, he's already taken down each of his teammates-turned-rivals in both one-on-one and team brawls. But the "Light and Agile" Award winner has yet to taste defeat in his illustrious career - Butler, Carty, Megill among others have at one time or another fallen to this iconic figure.
Flash Results by Game
:
Edwards victorious 5 to 2
Marzarella: 4, 7
Edwards: 1, 2, 3, 5, 6
A straight-shooting, no nonsense collision between former allies is what was on the card - and those that witnessed this spectacle can tell you first hand that's exactly what they got.
Edwards took the early lead in this heated debate. After an hour of heart-pounding, body-bruising mayhem, "The Crazy One" racked up two more, already signaling the demise of his longtime "friend". Even the individual eliminations favored "The Crazy One"! Though a loss appeared imminent, Marzarella refused to go down without a fight, securing two points much to his credit by the 10:30 mark.
Moments & Stars
: Chris Adams and Robert Brown's bulletballs fiercely colliding; several players hilariously pretending to be zombies, most notably Diana DiBuccio; Rob Nieratko's insanely wicked headshot on
teammate
Chris Adams; Sascha Basista collapsing following a most painful nutshot from, you guessed it, Chris "The Axe" Adams
RECORDS
> Attendance: 24
> Notable Returns: Gerald Lewis (last competed at DB 103); Rob Nieratko (last competed at DB 108); Ryan McCrorey (last competed at DB 116)
> New Players: (1) James Ahern
- One thing certainly worth nothing was the absence of the radio.
- Captains Ray Marzarella and Mike Edwards competed under
GodMode Rules
, first seen [and created on the spot] by birthday boys Lenny Herrera and Mike "Sputz" Krott at
DODGEBALL 85
.
- In the main event, Edwards would go on to defeat Marzarella, 5 to 2. Edwards moves up the ladder of success, now with an incomparable record of 5-0-1. Marzarella, more of a team battle specialist, is now 3-3-2.
You Can't See Me!
Chris Adams, Tom Adams, Kevin Adams and as of DODGEBALL 122, Mike Edwards have all reached five singles victories.
Throw in the Towel Already!
Alison Bertsch, Sara DeCuir, Steve Adams and Ryan Letsche have each suffered four singles defeats. John Tronolone has been beaten five times, while one Derek Carty holds the record with six.
PondScum: The History
Their have been three incarnations of the rebellious clan
PondScum
. The third formation, which included the likes of Gerald Lewis, John Tronolone, Ray Marzarella, and Mike Edwards, faced and defeated all comers in the 2007 Monmouth University Co-Ed Division.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Plenty more in store for Season 13!
DODGEBALL 123: January 26, 2008 (Kevin Fitzpatrick vs. Lenny Herrera)
DODGEBALL 124: February 2, 2008 ("Secret Selection")
DODGEBALL 125: February 9, 2008
DODGEBALL 126: February 16, 2008
DODGEBALL 127: February 23, 2008 (WALL vs. ALL 5)
DODGEBALL 128: March 1, 2008
DODGEBALL 129: March 8, 2008
DODGEBALL 130: March 15, 2008

Ray Marzarella vs. Mike Edwards Results from 122!
January 19, 2008 - one man's date with destiny.

For blocking extraordinaire, a win over "The Crazy One" would have undeniably granted him the top ranking in the controversial, rebellious clan PondScum. After all, he's already taken down each of his teammates-turned-rivals in both one-on-one and team brawls. But the "Light and Agile" Award winner has yet to taste defeat in his illustrious career - Butler, Carty, Megill among others have at one time or another fallen to this iconic figure.

Flash Results by Game: Edwards victorious 5 to 2
Marzarella: 4, 7
Edwards: 1, 2, 3, 5, 6

A straight-shooting, no nonsense collision between former allies is what was on the card - and those that witnessed this spectacle can tell you first hand that's exactly what they got.

Edwards took the early lead in this heated debate. After an hour of heart-pounding, body-bruising mayhem, "The Crazy One" racked up two more, already signaling the demise of his longtime "friend". Even the individual eliminations favored "The Crazy One"! Though a loss appeared imminent, Marzarella refused to go down without a fight, securing two points much to his credit by the 10:30 mark.

Moments & Stars: Chris Adams and Robert Brown's bulletballs fiercely colliding; several players hilariously pretending to be zombies, most notably Diana DiBuccio; Rob Nieratko's insanely wicked headshot on teammate Chris Adams; Sascha Basista collapsing following a most painful nutshot from, you guessed it, Chris "The Axe" Adams

RECORDS
> Attendance: 24
> Notable Returns: Gerald Lewis (last competed at DB 103); Rob Nieratko (last competed at DB 108); Ryan McCrorey (last competed at DB 116)
> New Players: (1) James Ahern

- One thing certainly worth nothing was the absence of the radio.
- Captains Ray Marzarella and Mike Edwards competed under GodMode Rules, first seen [and created on the spot] by birthday boys Lenny Herrera and Mike "Sputz" Krott at DODGEBALL 85.
- In the main event, Edwards would go on to defeat Marzarella, 5 to 2. Edwards moves up the ladder of success, now with an incomparable record of 5-0-1. Marzarella, more of a team battle specialist, is now 3-3-2.

You Can't See Me!
Chris Adams, Tom Adams, Kevin Adams and as of DODGEBALL 122, Mike Edwards have all reached five singles victories.

Throw in the Towel Already!
Alison Bertsch, Sara DeCuir, Steve Adams and Ryan Letsche have each suffered four singles defeats. John Tronolone has been beaten five times, while one Derek Carty holds the record with six.

PondScum: The History
Their have been three incarnations of the rebellious clan PondScum. The third formation, which included the likes of Gerald Lewis, John Tronolone, Ray Marzarella, and Mike Edwards, faced and defeated all comers in the 2007 Monmouth University Co-Ed Division.
